meanings.sent1: The squirrel will skitter across the grass to reach its acorn stash.
meanings.sent2: The children love to skitter around the playground during recess.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse decided to skitter away from the cat, making a quick escape.
meanings.sent4: The leaves skittered along the sidewalk in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's feet skittered across the stage, creating a mesmerizing performance.

meanings.definition: To glide or skip along a surface
meanings.sent1: The stone will skitter across the calm lake before sinking.
meanings.sent2: The skipping rope will skitter along the pavement as the children play.
meanings.sent3: The skateboarder tried to skitter along the rail but ended up falling.
meanings.sent4: The paper airplane skittered through the air before landing on the desk.
meanings.sent5: The pebble skittered down the mountain slope, leaving a trail behind.

meanings.definition: A quick, light movement or sound
meanings.sent1: The sudden skitter of the lizard caught the attention of the hikers.
meanings.sent2: The skitter of the insects in the bushes added to the nighttime symphony.
meanings.sent3: The skitter of the falling raindrops on the roof was a soothing lullaby.
meanings.sent4: The skitter of the mouse in the attic made the children giggle.
meanings.sent5: The skitter of the pebbles rolling down the hill echoed in the valley.
